items.summary: The directive is prompted by a number of cases of delayed reporting of board-level appointments' information. The order indicates that in many instances, such critical adverse inputs as private complaints, court observations, references or inputs from the CBI or other law enforcement agencies are being reported only when vigilance clearance is specifically sought from the Chief Vigilance Officers (CVO) of PSUs at the time of promotion or appointment.

items.title: NCLAT rejects NCLT order, directs fresh hearing in Culver Max insolvency petition against fintech firm
items.summary: The NCLAT has overturned an NCLT decision that rejected Culver Max Entertainment's insolvency plea against a fintech firm, allowing the broadcaster a chance to rectify application defects.&nbsp;

items.title: India sets first-ever testing standard for electric farm tractors
items.summary: New testing protocols for electric agricultural tractors have been introduced to ensure safety and performance. The Bureau of Indian Standards has created a dedicated standard to fill regulatory gaps, promoting confidence among manufacturers and farmers as electric tractors enter the market.

items.title: ₹1.58 lakh crore exodus: India stock market sees highest-ever FPI outflows in 2025
items.summary: Foreign portfolio investors sold  ₹22,130 worth of Indian stocks in December 2025, contributing to a total outflow of  ₹1,58,407 crore for the year. Meanwhile, domestic institutional remain invested, supporting the market amid declining FPI sentiment.

items.title: Civil aviation ministry's 24x7 control room seeks to address passengers' issues promptly
items.summary: The civil aviation ministry has launched a 24/7 Passenger Assistance Control Room. This center, staffed by officials from the ministry, DGCA, airlines, and AAI, resolves passenger issues. It addresses flight cancellations, lost baggage, and refund delays. The control room aims for timely grievance redressal and improved passenger experience across the aviation sector.

items.title: Private equity investments in India's realty slip as investors play safe
items.summary: Private equity (PE) investments in Indian real estate moderated in 2025 amid global reassessment of risk, returns, and execution timelines, even as domestic fundamentals remained resilient. Total PE inflows stood at $3.5 billion, down 29% year-on-year, with office assets continuing to dominate, attracting 58% of total investment. Residential (17%) and warehousing (15%) followed, while retail activity remained limited.

items.title: Centre notifies guidelines for two shipbuilding initiatives with an outlay of ₹44,700 crore
items.summary: This comes after the Union Cabinet on September 25 approving a comprehensive package of ₹69,725 crore to revitalise India’s shipbuilding and maritime ecosystem.

items.title: Akum Pharma’s Finance chief Rajkumar Bafna resigns citing pollution in Delhi
items.summary: This is probably the first public instance that the senior management personnel of a listed company has cited pollution in Delhi NCR as the reason behind resignation

items.title: Centre steps up passenger protection measures: MoCA Secretary Samir Sinha
items.summary: MoCA is in the process of instituting new systems and strengthening institutional capacity to deal with large-scale operational failures.

items.title: In a first, ground handling firm AISATS to use simulators for staff training
items.summary: The company is already present in Bengaluru, Delhi, Hyderabad, Mangaluru, Ranchi, Raipur and Thiruvananthapuram. Additionally, it is developing a multi-modal cargo hub at Noida airport

items.title: Mint Explainer | How the advance tipping ban could change ride-hailing bookings
items.summary: The advance tipping feature was first rolled out first by Google-backed Namma Yatri in Bengaluru and was soon mirrored across platforms such as Uber, Ola, and Rapido, especially during peak hours and high-demand zones.

items.title: BIS releases national testing standard for electric agricultural tractors
items.summary: It establishes a common understanding among all stakeholders with respect to uniform terminology, general guidelines, and tests to be carried out on electric agricultural tractors on various parameters

items.title: Mumbai’s vertical boom runs ahead of infrastructure
items.summary: Mumbai's skyline is rapidly ascending with high-rise towers, but critics argue this unchecked vertical growth lacks planning, coherence, and consideration for infrastructure. This trend, driven by profit over planning, results in a chaotic urban landscape where new developments disregard neighborhood character and historical town planning principles, leading to congestion and shrinking public spaces.

items.title: Satcom services to be rolled out after Elon Musk's Starlink & other players comply with security clearances: Jyotiraditya Scindia
items.summary: Satellite communication services are set to launch in India once companies like Starlink meet security agency demands, including data localization. Spectrum pricing is being finalized by DoT and Trai, with potential differences to be resolved by the Digital Communication Commission. Meanwhile, the government is still considering relief for Vodafone Idea, which faces significant liabilities.

items.title: Ola Electric ramps up deliveries of '4680 Bharat Cell' vehicles
items.summary: Ola Electric is now delivering its S1 Pro+ scooters powered by its own 4680 Bharat Cell batteries. Deliveries have expanded across Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Telangana, and Karnataka. This move makes Ola Electric the first Indian company to fully own its cell and battery pack manufacturing process. The company plans to roll out these vehicles nationwide soon.

items.title: Experts recommend 'micro-hospitals' as India's new shield against rising non-communicable diseases
items.summary: India faces a growing epidemic of non-communicable diseases. Experts propose a solution: micro-hospitals. These facilities will offer specialist-led coordinated care and reduce wait times. This model aims to bridge the gap between primary clinics and large hospitals. Micro-hospitals will provide diagnostics and interventions closer to communities. This approach promises better patient outcomes and restored trust in healthcare.

items.title: Sigachi CEO held, remanded
items.summary: Sigachi CEO Amit Raj Sinha remanded amid ongoing probe into the deadly fire incident

items.title: Office leads private equity inflows in 2025; overall real estate investment at USD 3.5 billion: Knight Frank India
items.summary: Office real estate attracted more than USD 2 billion in PE investments during the year, accounting for 58 per cent of total inflows, even as overall real estate investments stood at USD 3.5 billion.

items.title: SEBI walks a fine line in 2025 on ease of doing business and tough enforcement
items.summary: From giving firms more room to meet public shareholding norms to bringing in a system overhaul to ease operational challenges, SEBI handed out freedom while practising restraint at the same time.

items.title: Taiwan’s universal cash handout: Its economic rationale holds a lesson for similarly placed India
items.summary: Taipei’s cash transfer to all citizens underscores how high GDP growth can go with uneven earnings and consumption. India faces similar constraints, but Taiwan's use of handouts as a macro-stabilizer rather than a political tool is instructive.

items.title: Port reforms, increased shipbuilding activity drive credit surge to shipping sector
items.summary: The outstanding credit in the sector has risen nearly 2x compared to the ₹5,364 crore outstanding as of October 2020

items.title: Tariff-hit 2025, but India's exports chart a steady course, momentum likely to extend into 2026

items.title: Premiumisation, smart products to drive appliances and consumer electronics sector in 2026
items.summary: India's appliance and consumer electronics market is set for significant growth. It is expected to become the fourth-largest globally by FY27. Revenues are projected to reach Rs 3 lakh crore by FY29. This expansion is fueled by rising incomes and better access to consumer finance. Companies are investing in manufacturing and innovation.

items.title: Pvt equity investments in real estate down 29 pc this yr to USD 3.46 bn: Knight Frank
items.summary: Private equity investments in Indian real estate dropped 29% to USD 3.46 billion this year, primarily due to reduced funding in housing and warehousing projects. Despite improved macro-economic conditions, investors remained cautious, leading to a sharp recalibration in capital deployment. However, a recovery to USD 4.4 billion is anticipated in 2026, driven by selective growth.

items.title: Bondi attack: No, Islamic State isn’t back in Asia but its influence sure has endured across the region
items.summary: It has weakened in recent years but the Bondi attack showed it still has followers across the region whom it influences through social media and online propaganda. Policymakers will have to counter its threat with a digital-first approach.

items.title: Customer experience, value to drive India’s food delivery growth in 2026: Swiggy, magicpin
items.summary: India's food delivery sector is set for significant growth in 2026. Customer experience, speed, and value will be key drivers. Magicpin and Swiggy highlight the importance of catering to value-conscious users and expanding merchant inclusion. The industry is evolving to meet tighter schedules and changing priorities. Faster, more balanced, and reliable delivery options will be crucial.

items.title: India in 2026: Here are three big shifts that are quietly underway but few are talking about them
items.summary: Greater openness, stronger state-level investment and better-balanced macro policies are gains the country must hold on to. If India can do so, it could turn today’s early gains into more durable, broad-based economic growth.

items.title: Indian aviation awaits smoother skies, AI171 crash report in 2026
items.summary: While airfare caps became a recurring theme in 2026, airlines continued to bleed with airspace closures and network disruptions even as the duopolistic-domestic market witnessed expansion of air connectivity

items.summary: Culver Max Entertainment receives a reprieve from the NCLAT. The appellate tribunal has overturned a previous NCLT decision that dismissed an insolvency plea against a fintech firm. The case will now be heard again by the NCLT. The NCLAT emphasized that Culver Max should have been given a chance to fix application defects.

items.title: Macro data announcements, trading activity of foreign investors to drive markets this week: Analysts
items.summary: With only a handful of trading sessions left this year, Indian equity markets are expected to remain largely range-bound, albeit with a constructive bias, according to a market analyst

items.title: AI dissonance: Politics over artificial intelligence is a phenomenon that can’t be wished away
items.summary: Lobbying over regulation will intensify in the West amid friction between businesses and governments over the regulation of artificial intelligence. In India, where AI adoption is likely to split opinion, will probably see other forms of dissonance.

items.title: India's forex reserve jumps $4.37 billion to near record high of $693.32 billion — Here's how much gold RBI holds
items.summary: RBI data released on 26 December shows that India's forex reserves recorded a $4.37 billion jump to a near record high of $693.32 billion as of 19 December 2025. Here's how much gold the central bank holds in its reserves.

items.title: The year of tariffs: India's exports impacted, yet stay on a steady course in 2025; momentum likely to extend into 2026
items.summary: Indian exports look set for strong growth in 2026. Diversification and new trade pacts with the UK, Oman and New Zealand will boost shipments. Despite US tariffs, exports to America surged in 2025. Electronics, engineering, and pharmaceuticals lead the way. Global supply chain shifts and India's improving business environment support this positive outlook.

The Finance Ministry issued this directive after instances where crucial adverse information was delayed. This includes private complaints, court observations, and inputs from law enforcement agencies. Such omissions are a serious concern for appointments and postings.

It would provide funding for long-gestation projects too.

These members are expected to join their respective benches by January 21, 2026. This development will enable the commencement of tax dispute resolution hearings shortly thereafter. State governments are arranging necessary space for immediate functioning.

A technical snag in a train caused an emergency brake application near Mahanayak Uttam Kumar station. Passengers were safely evacuated. Normal services resumed by 1 pm.

items.summary: India, known for its generic drug industry, is rapidly transforming into a major hub for global weight management industry, amid rapid increase in obesity-led disease burden.

The year ahead holds potential for growth and improved operations.

India's growing defence ecosystem makes it a strategic long-term home.

Exports are growing, with sales already surpassing last year's total.  Challenges remain for smaller producers seeking global reach.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein believes India could emerge as a winner if the US economy enters a recession, given country’s unique economic resilience and strong domestic drivers. “The largest and the fifth-largest economies have in the past often been fairly independent of each other without strong linkages,” analyst at Bernstein said. Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.

items.title: Avoid Indian equities, stay long on bonds
items.summary: Investing.com -- Investors should steer clear of Indian equities as corporate profits are set to shrink, and economic growth is expected to decelerate.

items.title: Bernstein says 'buy selectively' on Indian equities for 2025
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein says “buy selectively” on Indian equities for 2025, given macroeconomic challenges and earnings misses. It projects the Nifty 50 to reach 26,500 by the end of the year, a 12% return.
